course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Synthetic Chemistry Laboratory II
course.description: This is the laboratory course corresponding to the lecture courses CHEM 3120 and CHEM 3220. The topics of experiments covered in the laboratory course will be related to those taught in the lecture courses, such as electrophilic aromatic substitution and coordination chemistry, etc. For CHEM students under the four-year degree only.
course.corequisites: CHEM 3120 AND CHEM 3220

reviews.author: ilubyouboyz
reviews.title: Dennis is a passionate and reliable instructor! You will be missing him!
reviews.comment_content:
The contents corresponded to contents of CHEM3220 and CHEM3120. It also referred to some of the prior knowledge learnt in CHEM2250 and CHEM2150. I think they are quite useful.

To be concrete and clear:
Expt 1 - Separation of a Mixture by Column Chromatography
Expt 2 - Chemical Resolution of a Racemic Mixture and Polarimetry
Expt 3 - Carbon-Carbon Bond Formation by Aldol Condensation
Expt 4 - Synthesis of Schiff Base and Reactive Amination
Expt 5 - Synthesis of Transition Metal Complex and their Isomers
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dennis was explaining everything very clearly and knew clearly what students might be confused about. He spent appropriate proportion of time to explain the concepts and some practical precautions useful for hands-on operations.

The logistics of the course was smart enough!

To add, he was so efficient and willing to help out his students, this I experienced through our email conversations. When I was in the optional f2f lab sessions, he tried to chat with me and catch up with his students’ campus life. He was easy to get along and passionate enough towards teaching and caring his students.
reviews.comment_grading:
Reasonable grading! Here are some information about marks for my section.

30% Lab quizzes: (my score, mean / total mark)
1 - 6, 5.9/7
2 - 6, 4.8/7
3 - 4, 5.1/7
4 - 2, 5.1/7
5 - 6, 6.0/7

35% Lab reports: (my score, mean / total mark)
1 - 43, 49.1/53
2 - 53, 55.0 /71
3 - 56, 51.4 /63
4 - 144, 117.4/155
5 - 67, 66.9/80

35% Oral test: (my score, mean / total mark)
10, 5.8/10

Overall grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Dennis provided one to two videos for each experiment, but the length varied, some of them were around 10 minutes, some of them were beyond half an hour.

Each quiz was available for 10 minutes only, there were 7 questions in each. Open notes, open internet. Not too easy but not too hard as well.

The most time-consuming part of the course was writing lab reports. The time to complete a lab report varied, most of them could be finished within two hours, yet one of them spent me a week, one hour a day to sort things out since it was very difficult to handle!

reviews.author: 哈爾請食半島
reviews.title: One of the best course in chemistry
reviews.comment_content:
There are 5 experiments in this course.

1. Separation of a Mixture by column chromatography
2. Chemical Resolution of a Racemic mixture and Polarimetry
3. Carbon-Carbon Bond Formation by Aldol Condensation
4. Synthesis of Schiff Bases and Reductive Amination
5. Synthesis of Transition Metal Complexes and their Isomers
reviews.comment_teaching: Dennis will upload the tutorial and footage video before experiment day. You can watch it before attain the lesson. The questions for the lab quiz and oral quiz majorly come from the tutorial part and the lab manual. You can find all the answers in your hand-outs. However, plz study carefully before doing the lab quiz because you may not have much time to do it (only 10 mins solve 7 mc) if you do not understand the concepts. You can ask the questions to Dennis through email.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme:
30% Lab quiz
45% Lab report
25% Oral quiz

Marks:
Lab quiz: (My mark, mean, high, low) total of 7 marks for each lab quiz
1. 6, 5.4, 7, 2
2. 4, 5.3, 7, 3
3. 6, 4.9, 7, 1
4. 5, 5.2, 7, 2
5. 6, 5.2, 7, 2

Lab report: (My mark, mean, high, low) total of 35 marks for each lab report
1. 35, 31.8, 35, 21.8
2. 35, 32.9, 35, 27.9
3. 32.3, 30.6, 34.3, 20.5
4. 35, 31.9, 35, 19.4
5. 34.04, 33, 35, 28.3

Oral quiz: (My mark, mean, high, low) total 25 marks

25, 19.6, 25, 4.2

Overall grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
I think the workload is acceptable.

For the lab quiz, just as I have mentioned, plz study the tutorial part, the lab manual and the footage video. All the mc questions come in these three parts. No need to find answers through the internet as well.

For lab reports, lab1 2 3 are quite easy to finish but 4 and 5 are difficult. In lab 4 5, you need to find out some IR peaks to determine the functional group and require to do calculations for finding the coupling constant which is most challenging.

For Oral quiz, two questions are easy + 1 question is difficult. Although all questions come from hands-out, you need to remember of the content (lab 1 - 5) is quite difficult. So, you can drop notes and remember the location of the contents after answering the questions which is the most effective way .

Overall, the course is good. Pay more attention to some sig. fig. and find the peak more carefully can help you get the better grade.

reviews.author: JK1
reviews.comment_content:
Experiment 1: Separation of Mixture by Column Chromatography (1 Day)
Experiment 2: Resolution using a Chiral Amine as a Resolving Agent
Experiment 3: Aldol Condensation (1 Day)
Experiment 4: Synthesis of Amine and Amide: Reductive Amination and Acetylation
Experiment 5: Synthesis of Transition Metal Complexes and their Isomers
Experiment 6: Catalytic Transfer Hydrogenation
reviews.comment_teaching:
Basic synthetic strategies and skills
Great in teaching and TAs are very helpful
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance 5% (MSDS safety sheet + punctual)
Lab Quiz before each experiment 10%
Lab Performance 25%
Product 5%
Lab Report 25% (18 points Procedure and Observation, Data sheet, Question, 1 full-page discussion and spectral analysis)
Final Exam 30%

passing mark: 50% + attend all labs, submit all lab reports and sit the written exam
reviews.comment_workload:
Acceptable. You need to submit a lab report after the 1 week starting from the completion of each experiment.
Pre-lab before each experiment, 10% of marks are counted towards the grade.

reviews.author: bmad
reviews.comment_teaching: Almost useless. Boring and ineffective teaching style. The lecture notes given to students contains everything but useful information. If we want to keep important information, we can only take photos. I can't understand the point of doing this.
reviews.comment_grading: I got my worst grade in CHEM in this course. However, I don't know how I got it.
reviews.comment_workload: The lab reports contains a a section of discussion, which is mainly copying lab manual and lecture notes. It is extremely time-consuming and of no help for my study.

reviews.author: foreverA0
reviews.title: NO FINAL EXAM
reviews.comment_content:
Expt. 1 Separation of an Organic Mixture by Column Chromatography
Expt. 2 Resolution of a Racemic Mixture  
Expt. 3  Carbon-Carbon Bond Formation by Aldol Condensation
Expt. 4 Reductive Amination and Synthesis of a Schiff Base Metal Complex
Expt. 5 Synthesis of Transition Metal Complex Isomers  
Expt. 6 Catalytic Transfer Hydrogenation
reviews.comment_teaching: The TAs are so willing to help and the instructions are very clear. There will be TA demonstration before each lab begins, pay attention to the TAs and follow the lab manual and you won't be confused. Dr. Chan will sometimes give some hints on the discussion part, so just pay attention to his tips and you will be able to finish the discussion part.
reviews.comment_grading:
5%    Attendance
15%  Lab quiz
30%  Lab Performance
15%  Product
35%  Lab Report

Grading is lenient. Dr. Chan said he will give most of the students B range. For me, I get all the lab reports above mean and two of them are maximum. All the quizzes are above mean few marks. For the performance and product criteria, as long as you didn't break any equipment and follow the instructions well, you will receive high scores in these two parts.

Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload: Surprisingly, there are no final this semester. The major workload comes from the lab reports.

reviews.author: LukaModric
reviews.comment_content:
Expt. 1 Separation of an Organic Mixture by Column Chromatography
Expt. 2 Resolution of a Racemic Mixture  
Expt. 3  Carbon-Carbon Bond Formation by Aldol Condensation
Expt. 4 Reductive Amination and Synthesis of a Schiff Base Metal Complex
Expt. 5 Synthesis of Transition Metal Complex Isomers  
Expt. 6 Catalytic Transfer Hydrogenation
reviews.comment_teaching:
Clear for the briefing section.
Briefing slide will be uploaded before the lab.
Discussion questions for the lab report will be in the slide.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite many. You need to do MSDS by yourself and there are quiz at the beginning of each lab. Lab reports are submitted in canvas. However, it is already relatively light workload as no final exam and copying procedures are no longer required.
Can read some literature to answer some discussion questions.
Spectroscopic assignments will be required in later part of labs. Some are tedious.
Evaluation is required for each discussion in lab report which is somehow meaningless.
Prepare well for the quiz. Some may ask the structure of the chemicals (related to the experiments, not those examples) in the lab manual.
